description.narrative: Block 4 Foundation is a non-governmental research organization that seeks to promote the construction of spaces for the exercise ofcitizenship, activism and transparency in social policies in Mozambique from a global perspective, based on the social andhuman sciences, with youth as the epicenter of engagement. context of relations between citizens and the state. It emerged in 2007 as a community micro organization (Block 4 Association - Arts and Culture in the Community) of social intervention, having various artistic disciplines as a form of social engagement. The organization has the following strategic areas: Strengthening policy-making: As part of a long-term aspiration to contribute to policy-making and development, Block 4 will seek to highlightefforts to identify and institutionally impose, policymakers and opinion makers to act as a source of policy. advice to other institutions based on research carried out within our lines of research. In this regard, the Director will seek to broaden the level of engagement with policy makers, civil society, funders, and the people to open opportunities for research programs that are developed by Block 4 to provide the basis for policymaking. Youth Participation: Block 4 Foundation, through thematic research and advocacy grants, aims to foster youth participation in monitoring the relationship between citizens and the state in the context of policy development. Social In doing so, it intends to promote research and advocacy in areas identified in the strategic plan - which otherwise would not happen.

It emerged in 2007 as a community micro organization (Block 4 Association - Arts and Culture in the Community) of social intervention, having various artistic disciplines as a form of social engagement. The organization has the following strategic areas: Strengthening policy-making: As part of a long-term aspiration to contribute to policy-making and development, Block 4 will seek to highlight efforts to identify and institutionally impose, policymakers and opinion makers to act as a source of policy. advice to other institutions based on research carried out within our lines of research. Social In doing so, it intends to promote research and advocacy in areas identified in the strategic plan - which otherwise would not happen.
